title: For Sale:  YOUR FREEDOM AND 2ND AMENDMENT RIGHTS
location: EVERYWHERE IN AMERICA, Georgia, United States
postcontent:
“Gun control is part and parcel of the ongoing collectivist effort to eviscerate individual sovereignty and replace it with dependence upon and allegiance to the state.” – Lawrence Hunter, writing for Forbes.com
All the following quotes are from Washington’s Bog:
Laws that forbid the carrying of arms, disarm only those who are neither inclined, nor determined to commit crimes. Such laws make things worse for the assaulted and better for the assailants. They serve rather to encourage than to prevent homicides, for an unarmed man may be attacked with greater confidence than an armed man.
– Thomas Jefferson, 1764
What country can preserve its liberties if their rulers are not warned from time to time that their people preserve the spirit of resistance. Let them take arms.
– Thomas Jefferson
Those who beat their swords into plowshares usually end up plowing for those who didn’t.
– Ben Franklin
Arms discourage and keep the invader and plunderer in awe, and preserve order in the world as well as property… Horrid mischief would ensue were the law-abiding deprived of the use of them.
– Thomas Paine
A free people ought not only to be armed and disciplined, but they should have sufficient arms and ammunition to maintain a status of independence from any who might attempt to abuse them, which would include their own government.
– George Washington
Guard with jealous attention the public liberty. Suspect everyone who approaches that jewel. Unfortunately, nothing will preserve it but downright force. Whenever you give up that force, you are ruined… The great object is that every man be armed. Everyone who is able might have a gun.
– Patrick Henry.
Are we at last brought to such an humiliating and debasing degradation that we cannot be trusted with arms for our own defense? Where is the difference between having our arms under our own possession and under our own direction, and having them under the management of Congress? If our defense be the real object of having those arms, in whose hands can they be trusted with more propriety, or equal safety to us, as in our own hands?
– Patrick Henry, 3 Elliot, Debates at 386.
The Constitution shall never be construed to authorize Congress to prevent the people of the United States, who are peaceable citizens, from keeping their own arms.
– Samuel Adams, debates & Proceedings in the Convention of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, 86-87.
The right of the people to keep and bear… arms shall not be infringed. A well regulated militia, composed of the people, trained to arms, is the best and most natural defense of a free country…
– James Madison, I Annals of Congress 434 (June 8, 1789).
(The Constitution preserves) the advantage of being armed which Americans possess over the people of almost every other nation… (where) the governments are afraid to trust the people with arms.
– James Madison.
The best we can hope for concerning the people at large is that they be properly armed.
– Alexander Hamilton, The Federalist Papers at 184-B.
To disarm the people is the best and most effective way to enslave them.
– George Mason
The supreme power in America cannot enforce unjust laws by the sword; because the whole body of the people are armed, and constitute a force superior to any bands of regular troops that can be, on any pretense, raised in the United States.
– Noah Webster, An Examination into the Leading Principles of the Federal Constitution (1787) in Pamplets on the Constitution of the United States (P.Ford, 1888)
[T]he unlimited power of the sword is not in the hands of either the federal or the state governments, but where I trust in God it will ever remain, in the hands of the People.
– Tench Coxe, Pennsylvania Gazette, Feb. 20, 1788.





Sent from my iPad

title: For Sale:  .22 9" Six shot Nickel plated revolver
postcontent:
Trade for LCP .380?
Or best offer.

As times get tougher in the gun world you may want to consider this to keep your shooting skills in check, while reserving ammunition, yeah .22 is cheap but it is not  infinite.

Manufacturer:
Heritage Arms, they're a company from the south (yes, Made in the USA)

Action:
single (pull the hammer back each time to shoot)

Safety:
The revolver features a hammer block safety, great for a first gun, or when you're handing it to a newbie.

Condition:
Photos sorta speak for themselves, the Nickel is in near perfect condition.
Hammer pull is awesome and makes the famous sounds we love with revolvers, equally as famous as the sound a pump from a shotgun gives.

Decocking is sticky at a spot but is smooth (no pun intended). The gun needless to say shoots great every time, I have fired 1/4th a box of ammo through it and only had 1 failure, don't worry, the failure to fire was the cheap bulk Remington .22 ammunition, the firing pin hit it the same as the rest (checked the whole cylinder.)


Calibers:
.22 mag cylinder
.22 longrifle cylinder (also shoots shorts) 

Also includes:
factory box & manual
trigger safety lock

--- lets face it, no one uses these, but at least when the that state south of us (which is a sad excuse for a state) advocates we have their worthless gun laws nation wide, you will already have your trigger safety for when you aren't using the gun hahahaha, the lock is nickel also and would make a great gag gift.

contact me to exchange numbers, or to give offers. Trade or $.

Intrested in:
Mossberg 500
Remington 870
Glock 19 caliber conversion
AR15 caliber conversion
concealed carry gear or firearms.
Crimson Trace lazer sights

Will add money to the deal depending on what you have to trade.

Nikolai

ESEE knife and wallet not included.

title: For Sale/Trade:  IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOUR GUNS PAT ATTENTION
location: The great state of WEST VIRGINIA, West Virginia, United States
postcontent:
West Virginians,
If you love your guns and the week of thanksgiving has meant deer season for as long as you can remember, then listen up.     Please take the time to write your elected officials in Washington DC. in regards to the anti gun policies that are being pushed.  Please pay attention to what is going on there.   Even if you don't have an AR or an AK let them know you don't want your rights trampled on.  Stand together as hunters and shooters.  Hunting and guns has been a part of my family in this state since well before it had "west" in front of its name.  It may not come in our generation but if we let them start registering guns and labeling us eventually it can and likely will lead to confiscation.  Yeah, I know what they say, "No it won't happen".  I am sure people in Britain and Australia thought the same thing.  Write your officials, and tell them not to make hasty emotional decisions.  Each official is easy to find make your voices heard as hunters and shooters.  Don't think just because you don't have a gun on the banned list it won't affect you, or you don't buy ammo off of the internet, etc.  If there are more regulations on guns and ammo, at the very least it will raise prices.  That buck you kill each year will cost a little more until finally it becomes a hobby you just don't do anymore.  Thanks.

Mountaineers are always Free

title: For Sale:  New England Arms Single Shot Rifle w/ 45-70, 45-110 Sharps, .243 and 410 shotgun barrels
postcontent:
Hello, 
I have a very nice New England Arms break-open rifle with a bunch of barrels and accessories.  The receiver is for large rifle calibers.  I sent it back to the factory to have them fit the additional barrels.  It has a .243 barrel with scope rail and large Bushnell scope.  It's a real tack-driver, with very little recoil.

The next barrel is a 45-70 that I had professionally enlarged to shoot 45-110 Sharps cartridges (think Quigley Down Under!)   If you want to be the coolest at the range, this is for you.  The shells are about a foot long (I might be exaggerating a little there).  They are actually just shy of 3" long.  It kicks "a little"!   If you are not familiar, the 45-110 is a longer variant of the 45-70, just a longer case but same dimensions otherwise.  You can actually still shoot 45-70's in this barrel, as well as 45-90.   This barrel has iron sights and is drilled and tapped for a scope.  

The last barrel is just a 410 for fun.  It has a front bead sight.

 I purchased/ordered this all new many years ago, and it sat in my dry safe 99.9% of it's life.  There is almost no damage, and I would say the bluing is 100%.  I also have an extra cut-down stock (for a pistol grip for the shotgun or a slightly shorter stock for kids), some brass and reloads for the .243 and 45-110.  I have invested much more than I'm asking, but so it goes.  My loss is your gain.

I do not need to go though an FFL, but I would like to see an ID for my records, and I would greatly prefer a CWP.

I might be interested in certain trades like large-bore S&W or Colt revolvers, interesting/unique antique arms, but no junk please.  Obviously for the nicer firearms I would need to add cash, which I could do for the right deal.

I would consider shipping, but then I would need to go through an FFL, and the buyer would pay all associated shipping and registration costs. For this price-range rifle, it would probably be cost prohibitive.   But if you still wanted to, I would box up and prepare for shipping for free.

I'm located in Skagit County (near Mt. Vernon, Burlington and Sedro-Woolley) 

Sorry I didn't take pictures yet.  I'll try to post them tomorrow, or I can e-mail them to interested parties (after I take them tomorrow).

Thanks for looking!

title: For Sale:  THE CONSTITUTION AND YOUR 2ND AMENDMENT RIGHTS!
postcontent:
“Gun control is part and parcel of the ongoing collectivist effort to eviscerate individual sovereignty and replace it with dependence upon and allegiance to the state.” – Lawrence Hunter, writing for Forbes.com
All the following quotes are from Washington’s Bog:
Laws that forbid the carrying of arms, disarm only those who are neither inclined, nor determined to commit crimes. Such laws make things worse for the assaulted and better for the assailants. They serve rather to encourage than to prevent homicides, for an unarmed man may be attacked with greater confidence than an armed man.
– Thomas Jefferson, 1764
What country can preserve its liberties if their rulers are not warned from time to time that their people preserve the spirit of resistance. Let them take arms.
– Thomas Jefferson
Those who beat their swords into plowshares usually end up plowing for those who didn’t.
– Ben Franklin
Arms discourage and keep the invader and plunderer in awe, and preserve order in the world as well as property… Horrid mischief would ensue were the law-abiding deprived of the use of them.
– Thomas Paine
A free people ought not only to be armed and disciplined, but they should have sufficient arms and ammunition to maintain a status of independence from any who might attempt to abuse them, which would include their own government.
– George Washington
Guard with jealous attention the public liberty. Suspect everyone who approaches that jewel. Unfortunately, nothing will preserve it but downright force. Whenever you give up that force, you are ruined… The great object is that every man be armed. Everyone who is able might have a gun.
– Patrick Henry.
Are we at last brought to such an humiliating and debasing degradation that we cannot be trusted with arms for our own defense? Where is the difference between having our arms under our own possession and under our own direction, and having them under the management of Congress? If our defense be the real object of having those arms, in whose hands can they be trusted with more propriety, or equal safety to us, as in our own hands?
– Patrick Henry, 3 Elliot, Debates at 386.
The Constitution shall never be construed to authorize Congress to prevent the people of the United States, who are peaceable citizens, from keeping their own arms.
– Samuel Adams, debates & Proceedings in the Convention of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, 86-87.
The right of the people to keep and bear… arms shall not be infringed. A well regulated militia, composed of the people, trained to arms, is the best and most natural defense of a free country…
– James Madison, I Annals of Congress 434 (June 8, 1789).
(The Constitution preserves) the advantage of being armed which Americans possess over the people of almost every other nation… (where) the governments are afraid to trust the people with arms.
– James Madison.
The best we can hope for concerning the people at large is that they be properly armed.
– Alexander Hamilton, The Federalist Papers at 184-B.
To disarm the people is the best and most effective way to enslave them.
– George Mason
The supreme power in America cannot enforce unjust laws by the sword; because the whole body of the people are armed, and constitute a force superior to any bands of regular troops that can be, on any pretense, raised in the United States.
– Noah Webster, An Examination into the Leading Principles of the Federal Constitution (1787) in Pamplets on the Constitution of the United States (P.Ford, 1888)
[T]he unlimited power of the sword is not in the hands of either the federal or the state governments, but where I trust in God it will ever remain, in the hands of the People.
– Tench Coxe, Pennsylvania Gazette, Feb. 20, 1788.





Sent from my iPad

title: For Sale:  ar magazines at risk READ ASAP
postcontent:
Congresswoman Diana Degette (D) CO, has introduced legislation in the House of Representatives which would ban the manufacture, transfer and possession of new magazines over 10 rounds capacity. Existing magazines would be grandfathered HOWEVER you would be prohibited from ever transferring them even to family members. If this passes you are stuck with them and can no longer sell YOUR OWN PROPERTY. A perfect example of how the second amendment is not the only right these people spit on with regularity. This is basically the McCarthy Magazine bill from last session dug up and trotted out again. This measure has numerous democratic sponsors and they are trying to force it to the floor for a vote ASAP. The gun banners know that if they can get this legislation to a vote while emotions are still running high after Sandy Hook they have a good chance of passing it. That chance decreases every day. Please write house speaker Boehner and demand that this bill NOT be allowed to the House floor for a vote. Anyone can write the speaker, you do not need to be in his district or even in his state. Suggested text follows at the end of this post if you agree with it, use it as is, if not change whatever you don't agree with. You can do this in about 1% of the time it now takes to find a single reasonably priced high cap mag. Just fill out the contact form, cut and paste, or pick up the phone and call, or, better yet do both.

http://www.speaker.gov/contact

You should also contact your local congressman/woman. You can get the contact info here just by entering a zip code:

http://www.nraila.org/get-involved-locally/grassroots/write-your-reps.aspx

SUGGESTED TEXT TO THE SPEAKER

Dear Speaker Boehner,

I am writing you regarding the numerous gun control measures currently being circulated in congress, and the Diana Degette - D CO, magazine ban in particular. This measure would place severe restrictions on magazines over 10 rounds in capacity. These magazines are used by 10's of millions of law abiding Americans. I STRONGLY oppose these gun control measures and this measure specifically. They do not make us safer and do nothing but disarm and hamstring those who obey laws, while criminals simply ignore the laws in their entirety. A magazine ban will do NOTHING to prevent crime or mass shootings which are a statistically rare event, and have essentially 0 effect on our overall violent crime rate. After studying the effects of the 1994 ban on "assault" weapons and high capacity magazines the USDOJ concluded in parrt: “At best, the assault weapons ban can have only a limited effect on total gun murders, because the banned weapons and magazines were never involved in more than a modest fraction of all gun murders." The time required to change a magazine is trivial. I can do it in about a second and I'm slow. 

The 10's of millions of law abiding gun owners in this country are NOT the problem and we are frankly becoming very tired of being treated as though we are. The real problem is that these horrific shootings occur in so called "gun free" zones where the victims, or in the case of children, those responsible for protecting them, are disarmed and unable to mount any effective defense. When this is the case, the weapon used, and how many rounds of ammunition it holds, is frankly trivial. Any reasonably effective weapon can be used to kill large numbers of unarmed and helpless people. 

The short term, direct solution to these senseless and horrific acts is ARMED security in our schools NOW. Law enforcement officers are already in many schools and they should be in all of them. If the individuals who commit these acts knew that they would be confronted by an immediate armed response the number of attempts at these sort of mass killings would decrease dramatically. Compare the Sandy Hook tragedy, where nobody but the killer was armed, to the 1997 Pearl Mississippi school shooting where Vice Principal Joel Myrick was able to retrieve his handgun from his truck (it was illegal for him to possess or carry it in the school) and apprehend the shooter, Luke Woodham without Myrick firing a single shot. Luke Woodham's admitted plan after attacking his high school, was to go to the local Jr. High and continue his rampage there. Myrick stopped that plan cold. Unfortunately, there was no ARMED Joel Myrick at Sandy Hook. In another incident, in 2001, senior Jason Hoffman opened fire at Granite Hills High School in El Cajon, California. Hoffman wounded five people before being shot and incapacitated by, ARMED school resource officer (a police officer) Richard Agundez. An ARMED response to these incidents works, when it is in place. These individuals may not be afraid to die but they are afraid of arrest and prison. This is why they typically commit suicide rather than be taken into custody. The arguments against having the same armed police officers who enforce the laws and provide protection in the rest of society in schools are absurd. That includes the arguments against the cost. We could pay for an armed police officer in every school simply by cutting the foreign aid to countries where most of the population hates us. We have paid billions in aid to Pakistan, apparently, to hide Osama Bin Laden next to a military base. The money would be better spent protecting our own people right here in America.

The long term solution is to improve our mental health systems and address the real problem: The tendency toward violence in our society.

With regard to the Degette legislation I do not believe that this legislation should be allowed to come to a vote at this time. This is an obvious ploy to play on people's emotions immediately following a national tragedy. I am asking that you, as speaker, block this measure from coming to the house floor. The Senate routinely blocks legislation from being voted upon, in fact Harry Reid does so with monotonous regularity, and there is no reason the house should not do the same with regard to bills like this one. If the measure does come to a vote, please know this: American gun owners are a large part of the GOP constituency. You cannot win elections without us and as one of these gun owners I want this legislation defeated by any and all means at your disposal.

Sincerely,

END SUGGESTED TEXT

The SR-556® offers Ruger's legendary rugged reliability, and comes factory standard with a host of accessories that today's shooters demand. Employing a patent-pending, chrome-plated, two-stage piston driven operating system that provides the user with a cleaner, cooler running, reliable firearm that is truly state-of-the-art.

The end result is significantly improved performance over gas driven rifles.

•A repair kit contains the unassembled parts used to create a magazine and is to be used to rebuild a damaged magazine that the customer already legally owns. 
•A repair kit normally consists of a magazine body, follower, spring, and floorplate. Exact contents will vary depending on type of magazine to be repaired.

title: For Sale:  IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOUR GUNS PAY ATTENTION
location: The Great State of West Virginia, West Virginia, United States
postcontent:
My fellow West Virginians,

     If you love your Winchester your grandpa passed down to you and Thanksgiving has meant deer season for as long as you can remember, then listen up.  Please take the time to write your elected officials in Washington DC. in regards to the new anti gun policies that are being introduced in Congress.  Please pay attention to what is going on there.  Even if you don't have an AR or an AK, let them know you don't want your rights trampled on.  Stand together as hunters, shooters, and sportsman.  Hunting and guns have been a part of my family in this state since well before it had "West" in front of its name.  It may not come in our generation but if we let the Government start registering guns and lableing us, eventually it can and most likely will lead to confiscation.  Yeah, I know what they say, "No it won't happen".  I am sure many people in Britain and Australia said the same thing.  Get informed and then write your officials.  Tell your officials not to make hasty emotional decisions.  Each official is easy to find, make your voices heard as hunters and shooters.  Don't think just because you don't have a gun on the banned list it won't affect you, or that you don't buy alot of ammo on the internet etc.  If there are more regulations on guns and ammo, at the very least it will raise prices.  That buck you kill each year will cost a little more until finally it becomes a hobby you just don't do anymore.  Thanks for reading this please get informed and get involved with the political process in this country.  Your voices do count.

Mountaineers are always Free.

title: For Sale:  Hard to find GSG AK-47
postcontent:
GSG AK-47 unfired with two hi cap 24 rd magazines in like new condition with manual. $500
German GSG Sport rifles are fun .22 LR High Velocity semi autos.  If you have always dreamed of owning a AK47 but could not afford the now $1000+ to pay for it, you now have a suitable and economical alternative!! With larger caliber ammo prices going through the roof, and near unobtanium, the .22 cal rifle affords hours of fun for just a few cents a shot!! Great for inexpensive plinking, collecting or for tactical training without spending gobs of $$$ on ammo! This is very close to the weight & feel of the real legendary AK-47, and is an extremely well built German rifle.

http://www.thefirearmblog.com/blog/2009/05/02/ati-gsg-kalashnikov-22-ak-47/

The .22lr “Kalashnikov GSG AK 47” manufactured by GSG represents much more than a small caliber “knock-off” of a famous rifle. The GSG-AK47 is not only a well-made rifle, common of the German engineering we have come to appreciate, but it actually bears the name “Kalashnikov.” GSG is currently the only company in the entire world licensed by Mr. Kalashnikov to manufacture real, functioning firearms, and they have not taken this opportunity lightly. The low cost of shooting .22lr ammo is attractive, but not really at the expense of an unfamiliar rifle with awkward controls and an uncertain reliability aspect. Fortunately for those who of us who like military rifles, all these issues were not a factor with the GSG-AK47. The look, feel and controls are almost identical to the most heavily proliferated rifle system in the world. From the first time it is handled and shouldered, the heavy wood and comfortable stock length give the shooter the real feel of a familiar rifle. The magazine works and looks great and the accuracy potential was surprisingly well. Whether it is for los-cost training on the real system, a departure from the usual noise to give your neighbors a break, to help a youngster learn to handle this style rifle without the recoil and intimidation of the muzzle blast or just plain for fun, we think the GSG-AK47 will make a nice addition to any military firearms collection. -Jeff zimba, small arms review magazine
TXT 417-385-8five3O or email
Thanks for your generous considerations!

title: For Sale:  RIP John Noveske
postcontent:
News Release from: Oregon State Police 
FATAL TRAFFIC CRASH - HIGHWAY 260 WEST OF GRANTS PASS 
Posted: January 5th, 2013 9:23 AM 

Oregon State Police (OSP) is continuing the investigation into Friday night's single vehicle fatal traffic crash along Highway 260 (Lower River Road) west of Grants Pass that resulted in the death of a Grants Pass man. 

According to Sergeant Tyler Lee, on January 4, 2013 at approximately 9:13 p.m., a 1984 Toyota Land Cruiser driven by J, age 36, from Grants Pass, was westbound on Highway 260 near El Camino Way. As the vehicle negotiated a right curve, it traveled across the oncoming lane onto the dirt highway shoulder until it struck two large boulders. The vehicle rolled and NOVESKE was ejected. 

NOVESKE, who is the owner of a local rifle manufacturing company, was not using safety restraints and was pronounced deceased at the scene. 

OSP troopers from the Grants Pass and Central Point offices are continuing the investigation. Trooper Ryan Neuenschwander is the lead investigator. 

OSP was assisted at the scene by Rural Metro Fire Department, ODOT and AMR ambulance. No photographs for release. 

### State of Oregon: Oregon State Police ###

title: For Sale/Trade:  Offer
postcontent:
HUSQVARNA VAPENFABRIKS AKTIEBOLAG 
M/40
9mm

The Husqvarna m/40:

Simplified version of the Finish Lathi L-35 built under license in Sweden. The pistol was adopted by the Swedish Armed Forces in 1940, hence the model designation m/40. Chambered in 9mm.

History regarding this particular m/40:

1943 the Swedish government started to give military training to selected refugees from Denmark to resist Nazi Germany’s occupying forces. The Danish Brigade was trained in secret until spring 1945.

The Danish Brigade was equipped in Sweden with 2,000 Swedish military pistols (m/40, without serial prefix, with the “S.S.” inspector stamp, and in 67000-6900 serial range) which were removed directly from Swedish military stores.  

These guns followed with the brigade through the end of the war and then were later transferred to the Danish police. Upon entry into service with the Danish Police these pistols were marked on the side with “Rigspoliti” or "Rplt. S" and with a serial number.

In 1991 all remaining m/40 pistols in military service were melted down as the transition to Glock’s was made, making this an exceedingly rare firearm. 

Own a WWII relic!

This m/40 has matching serial numbers!!!! The serial number doesn’t have a prefix which indicates that it was a regular army production and the number itself (678xx) indicates it was one of the 2,000 m/40’s first transferred to the Danish Brigade!

“S.S.” inspection marks on the rear of the frame indicate that this m/40 was approved for service by Captain Sten Stenmo in Sweden. Also, this m/40 is void of refurbishment or import markings.

The red grips, or side plates, are also a testament to the time of its production. During WWII black Bakelite materials became scarce so the transition was made to red, as shown on this m/40.  

After service with the Danish Brigade this pistol was utilized with the Danish Police. Also this pistol has the rear lug on the backstrap that allows for the use of a stock :)

Pictures don't do this m/40 justice! I have a lot of supplemental information on this firearm so please don't hesitate to ask any questions! 

Please make me an offer or if you have a 1911 I'd consider a trade.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Walther PP
postcontent:
Walther PP, in good firing condition. This gun was actively used over 70 years ago in WW2 by German Military Police.  There are 3 insignias on the gun as well as a clear serial number. Gun was nickeled post war for collection. 

There is some rust on the gun but the gun is clean and further determination has stopped. This gun is a part of history, unfortunatly it likely saw many grave acts.  I inherited this weapon from my grandfather who collected pistols.  It has been appraised for >$1,000.

If you are interested in the gun, please make me an offer OR I would be willing to use this gun as part in trade for an assult rifle.
